channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report E-2024020466
item.description:
Report E-2024020466

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 13, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was damaged by a forklift and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged pail was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Due to jostling during the transit process a bottle became cracked causing leaking. Upon discovery the package was placed in a red tote and secured in the hazmat cage DescribePack: Crack at the bottom of bottle DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery was placed in red tote and secured in hazmat cage

item.title: Report X-2024021129
item.description:
Report X-2024021129

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION 2 OUT OF 4 BOTTLES OF ACETONITRILE WAS FOUND CRACKED AND LEAKED OUT THE REMAINING 2 HAD NO DAMAGE. THEY WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ACETONITRILE CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2024020390
item.description:
Report E-2024020390

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: KEARNY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 9, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of NA1993 was punctured in transit due to no dunnage and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel secured the damaged tote and proceeded to transfer the NA1993 to one (1) new 330-gallon poly tote that was fitted with the appropriate labels for further shipment and processing. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the released product in the trailer and swept them in with hand tools. The one (1) empty and damaged tote was cut up with hand tools. Two (2) 55-gallon poly drums of spent absorbents, PPE, the cut-up tote, and any cleanup debris were generated as waste and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed package to be wet with internal leakage, with a loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being dropped or mishandled. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Content will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2024021036

Report X-2024021036

  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed package to be wet with internal leakage, closures torn open and 1 of 4 items missing. Damage most likely caused from being placed on the wrong conveyor belt. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2024021005
item.description:
Report X-2024021005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at Hazmat location with signs of external damages. The package was inspected, and signs of internal leakage was found. Two of the contents leaked out. One was found without a cap and the other with a very loose cap. The remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The package failure came about due to a missing cap from one bottle and a loose cap from another. One of the bottles leaked out in its entirety and the other bottle leaked out approximately 1/16 of its content. No holes or punctures were found on either of the bottles that leaked. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: All contents were immediately inspected, caps were replaced and tightened and placed in a lined salvage drum to prevent any further leakage or damages.

item.title: Report X-2024020727

Report X-2024020727

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVE AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION 2 BOTTLES OF NOBLE LOW TEMP SAN WAS FOUND AND THEY BOTH WERE BOTH SLIGHTLY LEAKING. THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINE SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF NOBLE LOW TEMP SAN CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINE SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024020722
item.description:
Report X-2024020722

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-29
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT THE HAZMAT CAGE, UPON INSPECTION THE BOX OF ZEP CLOG ATTACK WAS FOUND TO BE EMPTY. THE CONTENTS WERE MISSING HENCE THE BOX WAS PLACE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE IN A HAZMAT BAG TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERS. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ZEP CLOG ATTACK CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO BE MISSING. DurationRel: 24 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE BOX WAS PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE INSIDE A CLEAR HAZMAT BAG TO AWAIT DISPOSITION UNLESS OTHERWISE.
